turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: I want to know who we give the public in contrast?  The department needs role models. Clean-cut, <u>forthright</u> men the public can admire.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I'll testify, sir.  I'm not afraid to do what's right.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: And I'll promote you.  You'll be a lieutenant immediately.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Ed, you're 30.  Your father didn't make lieutenant until he was 33.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I know that, sir.  I also know that when he made lieutenant, it was as a detective.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Jack Vincennes.  He's the technical advisor on 'Badge of Honor,' sir.  He lives for it. That's the way to get him.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: All right, Ed.  Call Sergeant Vincennes.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: I got the rap sheets on the black guys, sir.  Coates and Jones got charges a mile long.  But except for some kid stuff, Fontaine's clean.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Clean?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: More or less.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Until he gunned down six people.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Anything?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: So on active duty, Meeks didn't make an arrest from 1938 to '43.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Someone must've pulled the records.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Where are the police academy files?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: I don't have time.  I have --

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Just show me where they are!

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: You're twenty-two, aren't you, Ray?

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: Say what and so what.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Did one of the officers work you over a little?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: You look like Robinson after that last LaMotta fight.  'Course LaMotta looked a lot worse.  So you're twenty-two, right?

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: Man, why do you keep asking me that?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Just getting my facts straight. Twenty-two makes it a gas chamber bounce. You should have pulled this caper a couple of years ago.  Get life, do a little Youth Authority jolt, transfer to Folsom a big man. Orbit on some of that good prison brew, get yourself a sissy --

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: I never truck with no sissies!

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: That fucking Larry.  I almost believed him.

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: Believed what?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Nothing, Ray.  That Larry, he's a pisser.  You did the Casitas Youth Camp with him, didn't you?

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: Man, why're you talkin' about Larry?  His business is his business.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Ray, you protected Ty and Larry up in Casitas, didn't you?

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: You ain't woofin' I did.  Stupid down home niggers got no more sense than a fuckin' dog.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I heard you like to shoot dogs.

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: Dogs got no reason to live.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Oh?  you feel that way about people, too?

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: Man, what're you saying?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Ray, we got the shotguns.

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: I don't own no shotguns.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Why were you throwing clothes in the building incinerator?

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: Say what?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: You guys were arrested this morning, but none of you have last night's clothes.  <u>You</u> were seen burning them.  Add to that the fact that you hid the car you were cruising around in last night and it doesn't look good.

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: I got nothin' more to say till I see a judge.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Were you on hop?  You were passed out when you got arrested.  Were you hopped up, Ray?

turns.speaker: COATES
turns.text: Ty and Larry fuck with that shit, not me.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Where do they get their stuff? Come on.  Give me one to feed the D.A.  Just a little one.

turns.speaker: COHEN
turns.text: What do you mean Deuce Perkins got clipped last night?!

turns.speaker: STOMPANATO
turns.text: They shot him in his library.

turns.speaker: COHEN
turns.text: I don't want a floor plan; I want to know who!  Who's taking the ticket for this, Johnny?

turns.speaker: STOMPANATO
turns.text: Nobody.  At least not yet.

turns.speaker: COHEN
turns.text: And what about the merchandise Deuce was holding for me?

turns.speaker: STOMPANATO
turns.text: Gone.  Not a trace.

turns.speaker: COHEN
turns.text: Some ferstunkener is moving in and we don't know who?!  Maybe we should ask Hedda Hopper!

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: This is Mr. Hudgeons, Wendell.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: I'm happy to cooperate.  You don't need to tie me down.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: It's for your own safety.  Now what can you tell us about Sergeant John Vincennes?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Trashcan Jack.  The Big V.  I can tell you he's on the Night Train to the big adios.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Take it easy!  I didn't have anything to do with him getting killed if that's what you mean.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: But you were business associates?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: What does that have to do --

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Okay so we worked together.  It was an information exchange.  I got him first class collars and he got me good stories.  We were friends for Chrissakes!

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Alright.  We'll drop that line for now.  Next topic.  Please comment on Pierce Patchett.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Okay.  Okay.  Everyone knows Patchett's worth a boat-load of greenbacks.  From aviation, freeway construction.  But the man has hobbies, too.  He bankrolls B movies under the table and runs movie star look-alike hookers. And try this on:  he's rumored to be a periodic heroin sniffer.  All in all a powerful behind-the- scenes strange-o.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: And what?

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Reciprocity, Mr. Hudgeons, is the key to all relationships.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: He runs call girls.  Primo tail. Fixed up like movie stars.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: In my car.  Blackmail shit.  The trunk under the carpet.  Patchett got me to photograph a cop fucking this gorgeous cunt Lynn, looks just like Veronicaaa --

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: That was his favorite toast.  I saw the test results on the lieutenant's exam.  You placed first out of twenty-three.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: The youngest applicant by eight years.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: You'll make lieutenant inside a year.  Patrol division?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I was thinking Detective Bureau.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: You're wrong.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Am I...?  Would you be willing to plant corroborative evidence on a suspect you knew was guilty in order to ensure an indictment?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Dudley, we've been over this.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Answer yes or no.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I... No.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Would you be willing to rig crime scene evidence to support a prosecuting attorney's working hypothesis...?  Yes or no, Edmund.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Would you be willing to beat confessions out of suspects you knew to be guilty?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Would you be willing to shoot hardened criminals in the back to offset the chance --

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Then for God's sake, don't be a detective.  Stick to assignments where you won't have to make those choices.  Patrol, Internal Affairs, but not the Bureau.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I know you mean well, Dudley, but I don't need to do it the way you did.  Or my father.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: At least get rid of the glasses. I can't think of one Bureau man who wears them.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Stensland's a disgrace.  Straight D fitness reports from every C.O. he ever served under.  But White is a valuable officer.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: White's a mindless thug.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: No, Edmund.  He's a man who can answer yes to those questions I ask you from time to time.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: You'll reap the benefits, but are you truly prepared to be despised within the department?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Yes, Dudley.  I am.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: So be it.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: You should stay away from a man when his blood is up.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: His blood's always up.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Sir, I took the call.  It's my case.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Edmund, you don't want it and you can't have it.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Yes, I do, sir.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: It's mine.  I'll make you my second in command.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: We got a call earlier on three Negro youths.  Firing shotguns in Griffith Park from a late-model purple Mercury Coupe.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Get on it.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Ed, I want confessions.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I'll break them, sir.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Don't get sidetracked.  Stay with the Nite Owl.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: She may still be alive, whoever she is.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: There are loose ends out there, Dudley.  I --

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: There always are.  But there are also three men and three guns. Matched forensically.  A few loose ends don't matter.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Something's wrong.  I feel it inside.  Doesn't that sound crazy?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: No... Where'd the tip come from?

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Anonymous.  Probably nothing.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: I'm loathe to kill my brother officers, Edmund.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Tell that to Jack Vincennes.  To Stensland.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Jack was a shame, but Dick Stensland had the audacity to try to sell me my own heroin.  Through his whore girl friend.  I sent him to make the buy.  The rest is history.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: A vacuum, Edmund.  That's what we have in Los Angeles.  Sending Mickey Cohen up created it.  My containment work maintained it. Certain photographs guarantee it. Organized crime has been held back, but there's still a demand for the services it provides.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: And now you'll provide them.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Absolutely.  Prostitution and gambling are victimless crimes. The heroin we'll run down to the coloreds.  Anesthetize them.  As long as it's not a middle class problem, no one will care.  It's still a crime free city... for respectable people.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: <u>No</u>.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Why not, lad?  Absolute justice?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: <u>Really</u>?  Would you be willing to rig crime scene evidence to support a prosecuting attorney's working hypothesis?

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: John, I doubt you've ever drawn a stupid breath.  Don't start now.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay.  I'll do it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You think golden boy can handle it, Cap?

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: I think you'll be surprised what Edmund's capable of.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: John Vincennes.  It's three A.M., lad.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Two minutes, Dudley.  It's important.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Lucky for you that my wife and four fair daughters are at the beach in Santa Barbara.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You remember Buzz Meeks, Dudley?

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: A disgrace as a policeman. Straight D fitness reports from every C.O. he ever served under. What about him?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Twelve years ago he worked a vice roust with Dick Stensland.  They arrested a Pierce Patchett on an extortion scam.  Guy ran hookers. He'd have them photographed with their johns, then double-dip for some blackmail.  Charges got dropped.  Insufficient evidence. You were supervising officer on the case and I was wondering if you remember anything about it.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: What's this all about, lad?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Part of it has to do with a murder.  I've been working with Ed Exley on it.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: You're Narco, lad, not Homicide. And since when do you work with Edmund?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's a private investigation.  I fucked something up and I want to make amends.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Don't start trying to do the right thing, John.  You haven't had enough practice.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Have you discussed this with anyone else, John?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DUDLEY
turns.text: Not even with Exley?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're the key witness?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I should've known.  What's the Chief throwing you?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: <u>Throwing me</u>?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, Exley.  What's the payoff?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: You're the payoff expert.  I'm just doing my duty.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're playing an angle, college boy.  You're getting something out of this so you don't have to hobnob with the fucking rank and file cops who'll hate your guts for snitching.  If they're making you a detective, watch out.  Some Bureau guys are gonna burn in this and you're gonna have to work with friends of theirs.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm snitching three old timers who'll be fishing in Oregon next week.  Next to you I'm clean.  And smart.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: L.A.P.D.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>Shit</u>.  Someone beat us here.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Damnit...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Glasses.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just don't shoot me.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I need to speak to you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Give me a minute, will ya?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Damnit... <u>What</u>?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I want you to follow Bud White.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Even I'm not that crazy.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: It's not a request.  I need to know what White knows.  Follow him or I'll have you pulled off 'Badge of Honor.'  Permanently.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yesterday that might've meant something.  Pull me off.  You'd be doing me a big favor.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Yesterday yes, today no.  What happened last night?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Transfer me, suspend me.  Just leave me alone.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: You make a mistake?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.  My whole life.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Listen, I think I made a mistake, too.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I ain't a priest, Lieutenant.  I can't hear your confession.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Do you make the three Negroes for the Nite Owl killings?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: It's a simple question.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You should be the last person who wants to dig any deeper into the Nite Owl, <u>Lieutenant</u>.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is there more to that, or do I have to guess?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Rollo was a purse snatcher.  My father ran into him off duty.  He shot my father six times and got away clean.  No one even knew who he was.  I made the name up to give him some personality.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So what's the point?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Rollo's the reason I became a cop. I wanted to catch the guys who thought they could get away with it.  It was supposed to be about truth and justice and Rollo.  But somewhere along the way I forgot all that... How about you, Jack? Why'd you become a cop?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm trying to figure what angle you're playing <u>this</u> time, but I sure as hell can't see one.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I've given up angles for awhile. I just want to solve this thing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Nite Owl was solved, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I want to do it right.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay, college boy, I'll help you. But I want half the collar.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: A third.  I don't think we can make a case without Bud White.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: What's that for?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bud White.  He sees us and we're dead.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jesus... Maybe White's not so dumb after all.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Rita Hayworth at the morgue and now Veronica Lake with White. What the hell's going on?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Movie star hookers.  Whatever you desire... It's Fleur-fr-Lis again.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: What's Fleur-de-Lis?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: High line whores.  With plastic surgery to look like movie stars. And who knows what else?  It's run by this guy Pierce Patchett.  You want to talk to him?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Yeah.  But first I want to brace Stompanato.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She is Lana Turner.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She <u>is</u> Lana Turner.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I'm going to Lynn Bracken's.  I'll meet you at the Dining Car.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Great.  You get the girl, I get the coroner.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: What's on the call sheet?

turns.speaker: YOUNG OFFICER
turns.text: A guy dressed as Santa has been exposing himself to kids in Los Feliz.  Apparently, sir, he's decorated himself.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Decorated?

turns.speaker: YOUNG OFFICER
turns.text: With tinsel and plastic icicles and... on his penis, sir.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I get the idea.  You got a description?

turns.speaker: YOUNG OFFICER
turns.text: Of his penis, sir?

turns.speaker: PINKER
turns.text: We got a total of forty-five spent 12-gauge Remington shotgun shells. Three men with five-shot-capacity pumps.  All of them reloading twice.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Hold on... We need to canvass. See if a purple Mercury was seen around here tonight.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: The Nite Owl.  Anything bothering you about the case?

turns.speaker: PINKER
turns.text: Yeah.  The fact that you guys won't let it get filed away.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: PINKER
turns.text: Bud White grilled me on it this morning.  You know, he's not as dumb as I thought.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: We got a dead ex-cop and a girl who looks like Rita Hayworth at the Nite Owl.  Another dead ex-cop under the house of Rita's mother. It's not a good week for ex-cops.

turns.speaker: PINKER
turns.text: I got Vincennes in the next room. It's not a good week for cops in general.

turns.speaker: PATCHETT
turns.text: I'll tell you what I told Officer White when he asked me about Susan's death.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Bud White's been here?

turns.speaker: PATCHETT
turns.text: For the last time.  I may suborn women into illicit activities, but they're handsomely compensated, I treat them well and make sure the men they deal with show them every due respect.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Is the Veronica Lake look-alike one of your whores?

turns.speaker: PATCHETT
turns.text: A vulgar term, but yes.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: What's her name?

turns.speaker: PATCHETT
turns.text: Lynn Bracken.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Why's she seeing Bud White?

turns.speaker: PATCHETT
turns.text: Why do men and women usually see each other?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Anything else you want to add before I talk to her?

turns.speaker: PATCHETT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Not good enough.

turns.speaker: PATCHETT
turns.text: Then try talking to my lawyer. Good evening, gentlemen.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Miss Bracken, I'm Lieutenant Exley.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I know who you are.  You're the policeman Bud told me about.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Really?  What did White say?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: He said you were smart.  He also said you were competing with your dead father.  How did he put it? Trying to measure up to a ghost.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Let's concentrate on my smarts. Pierce Patchett made you, didn't he?  He taught you how to dress and talk and think and I am very impressed with the results.  But I need some answers and if I don't get them, I'm going to take you and Patchett down.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: He can take care of himself and I'm not afraid of you.  And you forgot one thing, Lieutenant. Pierce also taught me how to fuck... Can I get you a drink?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I'm curious about you.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: It galls you that I know so much about you.  You don't have information to compete.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Don't underestimate me, Miss Bracken.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: The way you've underestimated Bud White?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: How was I?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Oh, the best I ever had. Absolutely the best.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: You sound like you mean it.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: The silver screen's loss is your gain.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: How about White?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: You want to know what Bud's like in bed?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I want to know why you see him. Is it a Patchett payoff?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I see Bud because I want to.  I see Bud because he can't hide the warmth he has inside him.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I'll take your word for it.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I see Bud because he makes me feel like Lynn Bracken and not some Veronica Lake look-alike who fucks for money.  I see him because he doesn't know how to disguise who he is.  There's more if you want to hear it.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Does all that make it harder for you to hate him or easier?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I don't hate White.  I really don't.  It's just, in my business, it's the wild cars you have to watch out for.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: You don't like that you don't know how to play him.  He doesn't follow the same rules of politics you do.  That makes him dangerous.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: You cut to the heart of things, don't you?  What about Lynn Bracken?  She going to be a hooker all her life?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I came out here with a dream. That's gone, but I settled for reality.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Some reality.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: No.  This is the means to the reality.  But I'm not going to tell you what it is.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Because you'll use it against me. Won't you?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: You're tougher than Bud thinks you are.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: You're the first person to ever call me tough.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Like recognizes like.  I'm pretty tough, myself.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: You, me and White, huh?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Actually, Bud's only tough on the outside.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: If I knew you were coming I'd have baked a cake.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Forget everything else for a second, Lynn.  Is there anything you can give me on Dudley Smith?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: A police captain.  I think he's behind all of this.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I work for Patchett.  I had a feeling that there was someone else, but I never knew who.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Okay.  Look, if it helps, Bud hates himself for what he did.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I know how he feels.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Where will you go?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Bisbee, Arizona.  The air's good for pensioners and I know where everything is.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Right now, before I back down.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Do you think I ever could've been in the running?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Some men get the world.  Others get ex-hookers and a trip to Arizona.

turns.speaker: LOEW
turns.text: It's okay.  These are police.  <u>What</u> do you want?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I want D.A. bureau men to tail Dudley Smith twenty-four hours a day; I want you to get a judge to authorize a wire tap on his home phone; I want authorization to check his bank records and I want it all in an hour.

turns.speaker: LOEW
turns.text: On what evidence?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: None.  Call it a hunch.

turns.speaker: LOEW
turns.text: Absolutely not.  Dudley Smith is a highly decorated member of this city's police department and I won't smear his name without --

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Without what, his smearing yours first?  What's he got on you, Loew?  Pictures of you and an out of work actor with your pants down?

turns.speaker: LOEW
turns.text: Do you have any proof?

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: The proof had his throat slit.  So far you're not denying it.

turns.speaker: LOEW
turns.text: I'm not going to dignify youwith answers.  If you'll excuse me, I've got a Jack Vincennes press conference to prepare for.

turns.speaker: LOEW
turns.text: Okay!  You're right!  Dudley's got photos of me and Reynolds.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: What's Dudley's scheme?

turns.speaker: MRS. LEFFERTS
turns.text: It seems like my Susan, but...

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: When was the last time you saw her, Mrs. Lefferts?

turns.speaker: MRS. LEFFERTS
turns.text: At Christmas.  We had fought.  I didn't like her boyfriend.  I -- she has a birthmark on her hip.

turns.speaker: MRS. LEFFERTS
turns.text: Let my Susie rest in peace!

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Mrs. Lefferts, I just want to ask a few questions.

turns.speaker: MRS. LEFFERTS
turns.text: That other policeman already checked under the house and found not a thing amiss.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Officer White?

turns.speaker: MRS. LEFFERTS
turns.text: A sweet man.

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: Under the house.

turns.speaker: MRS. LEFFERTS
turns.text: All he found were rodents.  No signs of foul play.  So there.

turns.speaker: MRS. LEFFERTS
turns.text: My daughter was a virgin!

turns.speaker: EXLEY
turns.text: I don't doubt it -- Oh, God.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Big V Jack Vincennes!  May I have this dance?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Karen, this is Sid Hudgeons from <u>Hush-Hush</u> magazine.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: We did a piece last year. 'Ingenue Dykes In Hollywood.'  Her name got mentioned.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is she?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Beats me.  Look, Jackie-Boy, a friend of mine just sold some reefer to Matt Reynolds.  He's tripping the light fantastic with Tammy Jordan at 2245 Maravilla, Hollywood Hills.  It's right around the corner.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You lost me, Sid.  Who?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Contract players at Metro.  You pinch 'em.  I do you up feature in the next issue.  Plus the usual fifty cash.  Tell me, am I fucking Santa Claus?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I need an extra fifty.  Two patrolmen at twenty apiece and a dime for the watch commander at Hollywood Station.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Jack!  It's Christmas!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.  It's felony possession of marijuana.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: They're sitting in the dark, goofing on the Christmas tree.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Stand there with your camera. I'll stop here so you get Grauman's Chinese in the backgrouns.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: I like it!  I like it!

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: It's Christmas morning in the City of Angels, and while decent citizens sleep the sleep of the righteous, hopheads prowl for marijuana, not knowing that a man is coming to stop them.  The free- wheeling, big-time Big V, celebrity crime-stopper, Jack Vincennes, the scourge of grasshoppers and junk fiends everywhere.  You like it, Jackie- Boy?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, it's subtle.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: <u>Hush-Hush</u>.  Off the record and on the Q.T.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sid, it's Vincennes.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Jackie, are you back on Narco?  I need copy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.  But I've got something going with Ad Vice.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Something good?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't know.  I'm chasing picture books.  Fuck shots, but the posers don't look like junkies.  It's well done stuff.  I thought you might have heard something.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Not a word.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What about Fleur-de-Lis?  Their slogan's 'Whatever you desire.'

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: No.  No, I've heard bupkis.  Jack, I'll talk to you later.  Call me when you get something I can use. Smut's from hunger.  For sad sacks who can't get their ashes hauled

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: You're back, boychick.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sid, how are they hanging?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Down around my ankles.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: The Grauman's Chinese pot bust. He just got off the honor farm.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's he doing here, Sid?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: You tight with the D.A., trash?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sure, he just tried to throw me off the force last Christmas as a little joke.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: How'd you like a little payback? Not to mention a donation to the widows and orphans fund.  Did you know Loew was a swish?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And Reynolds?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: He's queer too.  Metro paid him two grand a week to fake it with ingenues.  On screen and off.  I'm getting him to fuck the D.A. for a hundred bucks.  That's twice the fifty you got for wrecking his career.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sid, why would a guy like Pierce Patchett get involved with running dope and hookers?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Where'd you hear that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Around.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Jackie, all I know is what you know.  The man is very rich.  And he's invested in freeway construction so he's gonna get a lot richer.  But that's it. Patchett's what I like to call 'Twilight.'  He ain't queer, he ain't Red, he can't help me in my quest for prime sinuendo.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Jackie!  You got some good scoop for the Sidster?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sid, cut the crap.  I --

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Give me some Narco skinny.  I want to put out an all hop-head issue. Shvartze jazz musicians and movie stars.  Maybe tie it into the Rosenbergs.  You like?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Shut up!

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: What's wrong, Trash?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: What happened with the kid and Loew?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: You didn't get my message?  It got called off.  The kid chickened out at the last minute.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He's dead.  I was just there. Somebody slit his throat.

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: Jesus.  Jack, that's a story. 'Swish Actor Gets The Gay Blade.' Let me get my camera.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Loew didn't go with him.  You're sure?

turns.speaker: HUDGEONS
turns.text: I put Reynolds in the cab myself. The night cost me a hundred scoots and I got bupkis.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: Pacific Coast Bell.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is Sgt. Vincennes. Requesting a name and address on a phone number.  Hollywood zero-one- two-three-nine.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: Please hold the line... No such number is assigned.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I just called it.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: No, Sergeant.  I checked twice.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A bootleg...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.  Sergeant Jack Vincennes requesting.  I need the home address on a Pierce Patchett.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: Please hold, Sergeant...

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Have we met before?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Was it a party?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Oh, I know.  A Fleur-de-Lis party, right?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fleaur-de-Lis.  'Whatever you desire.'

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Dope, liquor, hookers that look like movie stars.  Pierce Patchett has it all.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.  Me and Patchett go way back.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Pierce isn't like regular people. I dig him, but he scares me too.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Really?  How?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: You know, when I came out to L.A., this isn't exactly where I saw myself ending up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.  Me neither.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm pretty sure I can get you a part on the show... But tonight? Pretend it's an acting job, kid. Showbiz.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: And no one'll know about this?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It'll be our secret.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Showbiz.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Gee.  The Great Jerk-Off Book Caper of 1953.

turns.speaker: VICE CAPTAIN
turns.text: Vincennes, is there someplace you'd rather be?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, Cap.  Back in Narcotics.

turns.speaker: VICE CAPTAIN
turns.text: Oh?  Anyplace else?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Working whores with squad two.

turns.speaker: VICE CAPTAIN
turns.text: Maybe you should have thought of that before you made Bloody Christmas page one.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Brill?

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: Brill's dead. He died of small pox when he was two and he was buried in a Kansas field.  My name doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: It started with the information you gave me on DePinto. After we talked, he agreed to resign. Next, a phony detective asked me about Daniel Zavitz. Then an investigator questioned me about an extortion scheme they claimed Zavitz was behind. The FBI started looking into mob connections. A doctored picture in the paper. Overnight, I'm ruined. Wife. job, bank accounts, everything gone.

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: DePinto's dead.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Oh Jesus.

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: They found him yesterday folded neatly in a car trunk. What about Zavitz?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't know anything about Zavitz.

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: You said he was behind an extortion scheme.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: <u>They</u> said he was behind an extortion scheme.

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: And you were the last one to talk to him.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: What'd he say to you?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: What'd he give to you?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: Don't bullshit me, I can save your life.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'm telling you, I--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I just gave him my card.

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: He didn't give you an address? He didn't give you a phone number?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Nothing. Two nights later I was robbed. I'm pretty sure they were pros.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Um...who's that?

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: Don't know. Did you check everywhere? Maybe it was hidden in something. Maybe there was someone else--

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Someone else?

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: Maybe you bumped into someone who took it and you didn't even know.

turns.speaker: "BRILL"
turns.text: 209 to anyone! I need some help here!

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Who are you calling?!

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: It's actually DH-1 Digitech Pinpoint scanning with a frequency modulator.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: I don't know what that means.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Me neither, but the upshot is I've got color live-action footage of you and Ms Hawkins and it doesn't look good.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: So...how much money do you want in exchange for not ruining my life?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I don't want any money. And believe me, I have no interest in ruining your life. I'm not interested in this tape.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: You're not.
